Heading: Number of victims
Value: 2 teenage girls confirmed and found guilty of their murders, 6 others police can corroborate claims of slayings. Admitted to 48 and has claimed up to 71 women

Heading: States where killing occurred
Value: Serving life in Colorado but claims slayings in Texas, Colorado, Arkansas, Mississippi, New Mexico and California.

Heading: Type of killer
Value: Disorganized thrill killer, missionary (killing cheating women)

Heading: Family event
Value: New year’s eve 1961, Grandfather throws himself down well; 1963 aunt is brutally murdered.

Heading: Physically abused?
Value: Mother had fits of rage and was emotionally unstable

Heading: Psychologically abused?
Value: Childhood was succession of horrors and humiliations by older siblings and the mother condoned this.

Heading: Father’s occupation
Value: Ran dairy farm 1960’s, sharecropper, janitor, and deputy sheriff in their home town.

Heading: Highest degree
Value: Some high school but no diploma

Heading: Grades in school
Value: Smart but aloof with a shot fuse so didn’t get good grades

Heading: Saw combat duty
Value: No but did go to Vietnam

Heading: Applied for job as a cop?
Types of jobs worked
Value: Maintenance man, convenience store clerk, J and h flower company, assembly plant employee.

Heading: Sexual preference
Value: Heterosexual, but may have been bisexual

Heading: Killer age at start of series
Date of first kill in series
Value: Claimed to be 1970 an American GI in South Korea

Heading: Date of final kill in series
Value: Claimed to be in 1993 (shooting a motorcyclist in New Mexico)

Heading: Gender of victims
Value: Female, but claims some male too

Heading: Weapon
Value: Gun, ice pick, shoe string, screw driver, ant killer

Heading: How close did killer live?
Value: Walking distance, drove to crime for some

Value: Victim’s home, killer’s home, car, etc/
